title: National Building - vintage sans serif font id
content:
I'm looking for some assistance IDing the attached fonts.

I'd like to use one of these fonts with Burgues Script for a logo design. Any other ideas for fonts to go with this script would be appreciated.

Thanks so much.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326031508im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_3476.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326031508im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_4121.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326031508im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3_5455.jpg)
author: jjdewtt

comments.content:
NATIONAL BUILDING.. looks like Engraver's Gothic.

The bottom sample doesn't come too close to any fonts I can find (the original was probably not a digital font, right?), but I though perhaps [Geogrotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326031508/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/geogrotesque/) might have enough weights to allow creating a faux shadow font by layering, and to replicate the plain sans type by using a little graphic manipulating to flatten or narrow, as needed.

- Mike Yanega
